intro: Tristellateia bojeriana subsp. boinensis, commonly known as the Bojer's tristellateia, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its striking, showy inflorescences. The plant features lance-shaped leaves and produces clusters of small, tubular flowers in shades of red and yellow. It thrives in well-drained soil and requires full sun to partial shade for optimal growth. Due to its ornamental value, it is often cultivated in gardens and botanical collections.
